Title: Democracy under strain as fresh coup hits W’Africa, draws condemnations
Summary: Soldiers suspend polls, depose President Embaló as panic grips Bissau . AU, ECOWAS, Elders Forum condemn coup, demand release of detained officials . FG confirms Jonathan’s safe exit after monitoring tense elections .

Title: Armed attacks intensify as Tinubu okays U.S.-Nigeria security plan
Summary: Armed attacks intensify as Tinubu okays U.S.-Nigeria security plan . Armed attacks intensified across several states yesterday . Armed men attacked Ngige's convoy in attack on Ngige’s convoy .

Title: Gates Foundation commits $1.4b to help smallholder farmers, climate adaptation
Summary: Gates Foundation commits $1.4b to help smallholder farmers, climate adaptation . Commitment announced at COP30 in Belém, Brazil, where leaders are emphasising climate change .

Title: NEPC launches campaign against paraquat use in sesame production
Summary: The Nigerian Export Promotion Council (NEPC) has intensified efforts to combat the use of paraquat, a banned toxic herbicide in sesame seed production . The action follows recent threats from international buyers to suspend imports of Nigerian products .

Title: FG, Borno launch 2025/2026 dry season farming
Summary: The Federal Government, in collaboration with 16 state, has launched the 2025/2026 dry season farming programme . Wheat production programme is being implemented under the National Wheat Production Programme . Wheat is one of the focal crops, which is a focal crop .

Title: FG missed the point  —  Baba-Ahmed faults Tinubu’s security emergency
Summary: President Tinubu had recently declared a security emergency following rising cases of banditry, kidnappings and rural attacks . President Tinubu recently declared the security emergency .

Title: Edo launches anti-drug campaign in campuses to check abuse
Summary: Edo State Government has intensified its campaign against substance abuse among the youth . The campaign was led by the Senior Special Assistant (SSA) on Drug and Illicit Control to Governor Monday Okpebholo, Hon Andrew Efe .

Title: NAFDAC cautions manufacturers over products undermining Nigeria’s global rating
Summary: The agency’s Coordinator in Kano, Kassim Ibrahim, made the call during a 2 – day investors/stakeholders meeting . NAFDAC cautions operators and manufacturers within the Kano Free Trade Zone against sharp practices .

Title: Top 10 banks grow savings deposits to N33trn
Summary: Top ten banks in Nigeria have accumulated N33.24 trillion in savings deposits . Tier-2 banks lead rise in deposit . Two banks record decline .

Title: Pound to Naira exchange rate today, November 28, 2025
Summary: The exchange rate between the British Pound (GBP) and the Nigerian Naira (NGN) remained relatively stable on Friday, November 28, 2025 .

Title: NYSC cautions corps members against negative online posts
Summary: Director General of NYSC, Brigadier General Olakunle Nafiu, gave the warning on Friday while addressing the 2025 Batch ‘C’ Corps members at the NYSC Delta State Orientation Camp in Issele-Uku . He urged Corps members to be patriotic and to let integrity, efficiency, transparency

Title: Baba-Ahmed faults Tinubu’s security emergency, says govt missed the point
Summary: Yusuf Datti Baba-Ahmed said that the Nigeria Police can end terrorism and banditry on its own . The Labour Party vice-presidential candidate said the President’s approach, particularly the plan to rapidly recruit tens of thousands of new security personnel, is misguided .

Title: FG, states must provide free basic education, court rules
Summary: Federal Government, the 36 states, and the FCT have a legal obligation to provide free, compulsory, and universal basic education for every Nigerian child of primary and junior secondary school age . The judgment was delivered on October 9, 2025, in a suit filed by human rights lawyer, Femi Falana (SAN) and Hauwa Must

Title: 160,000 Lagos residents living with HIV – Govt
Summary: The Lagos State AIDS Control Agency made this known during its World AIDS Day 2025 press briefing held on Thursday . The figures reflect the latest estimates from January to September 2025 . The state conducted 222,415 HIV tests, representing just 28.9 per cent of last year’s testing output .

Title: NESREA seals six Ogun recycling facilities over environmental abuse
Summary: The National Environmental Standards and Regulations Enforcement Agency sealed six recycling facilities in the Ogijo community of Ogun State on Thursday . The move underscores growing concerns over unsafe recycling practices that release toxic lead and other heavy metals, posing significant risks to residents and the environment .
